data.title: Find In Files in specific folder without opening the folder in VSCode
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
  1.8.0-Insider
- OS Version:
  Windows 10 64bit

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open a file in VSCode
2. Find In Files.
    I want to search some text in specific folder without opening the folder. But I find I can only search in the opening files, can not search in other files in the folder. I have to open the folder before searching some text in the folder.
    I hope VSCode can support find in specific folder without opening the folder in VSCode first.

    I can do this in almost all other editors, such as UE, Notepad++, Sublime Text.

Thank you!

Steps to Reproduce:

Please make **vscode** save last session typing when open `cmd+shift+p` **command pallete**,
the big issue is I must type again and again the same text when using **command pallete** in vscode

data.title: Line ending setting ignored when restoring from backup
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. set line encoding to `\r\n`
2. create a new file with multiple lines
3. leave it dirty and reload

=> the file ends up using `\n` and not `\r\n`

Problems with Automatic Updates on Windows
data.body:
**VSCode Version: 1.8.-insider**

- VS Code insider from yesterday. Run check for Updates and VS Code exits / crashes after ~1 Minute. 
- Updated VS Code by downloading the latest installer and run it
- Executed Update again
- VS Code doesn't exit, however the Menu stays on 'Checking for updates' forever.

data.title: Represent modifier keys via key codes only when no other keys are pressed
data.body: When pressing `ctrl` for example, the define keybindings widget renders it as `ctrl+unknown`. This makes it difficult to troubleshoot keypress issues.

data.title: Zombie TS-server processes
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8 insider
- OS Version: macOS

Steps to Reproduce:

(note that I am running out of sources, did not try to reproduce from a real build)

1. open the vscode source code folder
2. run a search for "copyright"
3. replace all with "copyright2"
4. wait for all the heavy work to be done
5. ensure a ts file opens as dirty (it should automatically)
6. save all dirty buffers
7. wait for 5 seconds for the dust to settle
8. reload the window

=> at this point the activity manager shows left over TS server processes that seem to have no parent

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/21174229/2641c1fa-c1dc-11e6-9733-996b903d5513.png)

The process in question seems to be the typings installer:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/21174337/db1d4dec-c1dc-11e6-91cf-9c917733755c.png)

data.title: Word wrap toggle is switched off whenever zoom level is changed
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2  (7ba55c5)
- OS Version: Windows 7 x64 / Windows 10 x64
- Extensions: disabled all of them

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Write text longer than the width of the document
2. Toggle on word-wrap
3. Zoom in / zoom out (using `ctrl` + `=` / `ctrl` + `-` )

data.title: Green lightbulb not displayed
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.2 (7ba55c5860b152d999dda59393ca3ebeb1b5c85f, 2016-11-21T22:01:10.756Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions: none

According to the [documentation](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/languages/javascript#_writing-jsconfigjson), without a `jsconfig.json` file in a workspace, VSCode should displays a **green lightbulb** on the Status Bar prompting you to create one.

This is not the case. 

This issue was already mentioned in Stack Overflow:
[http://stackoverflow.com/questions/40428298/vs-code-javascript-green-lightbulb-is-not-visible](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/40428298/vs-code-javascript-green-lightbulb-is-not-visible)

data.title: Compute cursor/s state after edits were applied
data.body: Anyone invoking `executeEdits` now gets a chance to compute cursor state (especially the state of multiple cursors) instead of relying on our internal logic of markers movement. Besides, the provided  cursor state can be used in undo/redo as well.

data.body:

- OS Version: OS X

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a .coffee file
2. Use a forward slash without a trailing space makes the rest of the file turn red.

Possibly assumes it is a  reg exp?

data.title: Feature Request: Add file preview while searching.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: macOS Sierra

Sublime Text shows file previews live when fuzzy searching. It'd be cool to have this feature in VSCode.

1. Press CMD+P to search for files.
2. While using the arrow keys to move through the entries, the current entry should be visible as a preview tab.

Cheers

data.title: Auto start watch task

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.8.0-insider (2abfc207828739bd5b10d0bb8dbfea13506cfc69, 2016-12-13T09:48:23.832Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.3.0

It would be great if VSCode could auto start watch tasks when the project/folder (that has `.vscode/tasks.json` in it) gets opened  - (maybe setting `autoStart: true` in tasks.json) 

Many times (especially being on `insiders` which frequently asks to restart - sometimes more than once a day) I find myself forgetting to start TS Watch task - and scratching my head why the changes made in code are not being reflected.

Combined with watch task indicator would be very helpful - https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/8513

data.title: Should Keep Pressing CMD + DELETE still delete lines?

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2 (1.7.2)
- OS Version: OSX El capitan 10.11.5 (15F34)

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Write some lines
2.  Hold CMD, and press DELETE multiple times

**Result expected:**
Should keep deleting lines after the initial line removal

**Result observed:**
The cursor stops at the beginning of the line.


![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3578008/21162311/9e41a526-c141-11e6-8c5d-3df5e7b8a62f.png)

data.title: Node debugger sometimes continues rather than steps over
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.0 (38746938a4ab94f2f57d9e1309c51fd6fb37553d, 2016-12-13T17:45:32.595Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14965
- Node version: v6.9.0 (64-bit)

![2016-12-13_12-46-39](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/762848/21158695/1504d9c6-c133-11e6-8eb4-59b99341b388.gif)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. set up project as follows (and npm install twit)
```js
// blah.js
var Twit = require('twit');
console.log('should stop here');
console.log('stops here instead')
```

```json
// launch config
{
            "name": "Launch Node",
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/blah.js",
            "stopOnEntry": true,
            "args": [],
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "preLaunchTask": null,
            "runtimeExecutable": null,
            "runtimeArgs": [
                "--nolazy"
            ],
            "env": {
                "NODE_ENV": "development"
            },
            "console": "internalConsole",
            "sourceMaps": false,
            "outDir": null
        }
```

2. F5 to start debugging, should stop at first breakpoint
3. Wait 5 seconds or so (it's a timing thing, doesn't repro consistently)
3. Press step over button

Expected: stops at first `console.log` statement
Actual: continues until next breakpoint
